body_html: Changing the implementation would break a lot of code and the way this has been implemented is consistent with the rest of PyTorch, even if it isn't ideal. Probably best to issue a doc fix? Note that to comply with the standard definition of KL you should use size_average=False and then divide by the batch size. Also worth adding explicitly that the target distribution should be standard probabilities (to better contrast that the inputs that are supposed to be log probabilities).

body: Changing the implementation would break a lot of code and the way this has been implemented is consistent with the rest of PyTorch, even if it isn't ideal. Probably best to issue a doc fix? Note that to comply with the standard definition of KL you should use `size_average=False` and then divide by the batch size. Also worth adding explicitly that the target distribution should be standard probabilities (to better contrast that the inputs that are supposed to be log probabilities).
